contentrichtext.text: '''Victor Loche''' (1806 – 1863) was a [[France|French]] soldier and [[natural history|naturalist]]. In 1856–1857, he participated in an expedition to the [[Algeria]]n part of the [[Sahara]], and described the [[Mammalian Species|mammals]] and birds of Algeria in the book ''Catalogue des mammifères et des oiseaux'' published in 1858.<ref>Loche, V. (1858). [http://archive.org/stream/cataloguedesmamm00loch#page/n5/mode/2up ''Catalogue des mammifères et des oiseaux observé en Algérie'']. Arthus Bertrand, Paris.</ref> He first described the [[sand cat]] ''Felis margarita'' from a specimen found in the area of ''Négonça'' in the Sahara, and proposed to name the cat in recognition of [[Jean Auguste Margueritte]] who headed the expedition.<ref>Loche, V. (1858). [http://archive.org/stream/revueetmagasinde10soci#page/48/mode/2up ''Description d'une nouvelle espèce de Chat par M. le capitaine Loche'']. Revue et Magasin de Zoologie Pure et Appliquée, Series 2 vol X: 49–50.</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} {{Authority control|VIAF=209278499}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Loche, Victor | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = 1806 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 1863 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Loche, Victor}} [[Category:French zoologists]] [[Category:1806 births]] [[Category:1863 deaths]] {{France-writer-stub}}
